fields.summary: Unable to run instances of types with more than 1 CPU

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

fields.description:
If USE_CPU_PASSTHROUGH is enabled in the configuration file on a Node Controller then the cpu configuration for libvirt will be put in 'host-passthrough' mode. When this is done with newer processors the following error is encountered when migrating instances:
{code}
qemu-kvm: CPU feature arat not found 
{code}

This looks like a known issue that has been fixed as of December 2016: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1371617

We need to compile a new version of qemu-kvm-ev to address this issue.

Workaround: Don't enable CPU passthrough.
fields.summary: qemu-kvm: CPU feature arat not found

comments.body:
https://cbs.centos.org/koji/packageinfo?packageID=539  <- does not contain the source rpm with the fix discussed in https://bugs.centos.org/view.php?id=12266

http://mirror.centos.org/centos/7/virt/x86_64/kvm-common/?C=M;O=D does contain an rpm build on 12/14/2016, but I don't know for sure where to get the SRPM.

The build on the mirror URL might come from here but it doesn't indicate BZ 1371617: https://cbs.centos.org/koji/buildinfo?buildID=13884

So currently unsure where to go next...continuing the research.

Acquired source rpm from here:

http://vault.centos.org/7.3.1611/virt/Source/kvm-common/qemu-kvm-ev-2.6.0-27.1.el7.src.rpm

Built and tested packages.  Uploading to 4.4.0 and devel yum repos.

Tested migration successful with qemu 2.6.0-27:

On CLC:
{code:java}
[root@c-01 ~]# euserv-migrate-instances -i i-3bf55fea
[root@c-01 ~]# euca-describe-instances

[~sgraham] This is ready for your review, if you like what you see I will copy the qemu-kvm rpms on the nightly paths so that they get out to 4.4/5.0 dirs on downloads.

[~mbacchi]

Launched an instance on a 4.3 setup and it seemed to migrate just fine. 
{code}
[root@g-08-08 ~]# rpm -q -a | grep qemu
qemu-common-2.0.0-1.el7.6.x86_64
libvirt-daemon-driver-qemu-2.0.0-10.el7_3.4.x86_64
qemu-kvm-common-ev-2.6.0-27.1.el7.x86_64
ipxe-roms-qemu-20160127-5.git6366fa7a.el7.noarch
qemu-img-ev-2.6.0-27.1.el7.x86_64
qemu-kvm-ev-2.6.0-27.1.el7.x86_64
qemu-system-x86-2.0.0-1.el7.6.x86_64
{code}
[~mbacchi] sounds like this can move to QA

[~radams]:
We don't host libvirt-daemon-kvm or any other libvirt packages ourselves.  Only the qemu-kvm-ev packages.

Can you get the output of 'rpm -qa | grep -E "qemu|kvm|libvirt"'

Also we're not requiring libvirt-daemon-kvm at all, not sure what package requires it on their systems, but a query on an NC in the EQS built yesterday does not have it installed at all:


{code:java}
[root@b-27 ~]# rpm -qa | grep euca
eucalyptus-axis2c-common-4.4.0-0.25764.134.20170124gitfacfdb7.el7.x86_64

[root@b-27 ~]# rpm -qa | grep -E "qemu|kvm|libvirt"

Still seeing this at customer site, investigating libvirt-daemon-kvm involvement.
This is no longer an issue at the customer, they had installed the wrong qemu-kvm-ev version.
Moving 4.4.0 Issues from Release Pending to Resolved
